item.title: LLMs as verification oracles for Solidity
item.description:
Summary

  • Systematic empirical evaluation of GPT-5 as a verification oracle for Solidity contracts, assessing whether an LLM can predict the validity or invalidity of contract-specific properties.
  • Benchmarks on a large dataset of verification tasks and direct comparisons against formal verification tools (e.g., SolCMC, Certora Prover), using quantitative metrics and qualitative analysis.
  • Assessment of practical effectiveness in real-world auditing scenarios, exploring where LLMs succeed or fail relative to established formal methods.
  • Key finding: reasoning-oriented LLMs can be surprisingly effective at predicting (in)validity of complex properties, but they lack soundness guaranteesâ€”indicating potential complementary use with formal tools for smart contract security.

  • Research
